summary: This document is a memorandum of law submitted by the United States Government in support of its motion for partial summary judgment to eject Diane Fisher and Ron Soffer from a property recognized as consular property. The Government argues that the defendants have no legal right to occupy the premises, which are protected under the Foreign Missions Act.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is named as one of the original defendants in the Government's complaint regarding the unpermitted use of the premises.

persons.name: Diane Fisher
persons.context: Fisher is identified as a defendant in the motion for ejectment and operates as The Fisher Group.

persons.name: Ron Soffer
persons.context: Soffer is also named as a defendant in the motion for ejectment and has registered the premises as his office.

persons.name: Ivan S. Fisher
persons.context: Ivan S. Fisher is mentioned as a defendant whose subtenants, including Diane Fisher and Ron Soffer, are involved in the case.

persons.name: Serene K. Nakano
persons.context: Nakano is the attorney representing the Government in this case and has submitted declarations in support of the motion.

connections.description: Both are defendants in the motion for ejectment and are associated with the use of the premises for business purposes.
Diane Fisher is a subtenant of Ivan S. Fisher, who is the original defendant in the case.
Ron Soffer is also a subtenant of Ivan S. Fisher, sharing the same legal context in the case.
Both are named as original defendants in the Government's complaint regarding the premises.

events.title: Request for Stipulation
events.description: The Government requested that the subtenants of Ivan S. Fisher, including Diane Fisher and Ron Soffer, stipulate to the relief sought in the motion for ejectment.

events.title: Amendment of Complaint
events.description: The Court granted the Government leave to amend its complaint to name Fisher's subtenants as additional defendants.

events.title: Stipulation and Order
events.description: A stipulation and order was signed by the Court, binding all named subtenants except for Diane Fisher and Ron Soffer.

locations: 34 East 69th Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: The premises at 34 East 69th Street are recognized as consular property and are protected under the Foreign Missions Act.
Diane Fisher operates as The Fisher Group and uses the premises for business purposes.
Ron Soffer has registered the premises as his office with the New York State Office of Court Administration.
The Government seeks to eject Diane Fisher and Ron Soffer due to their lack of legal occupancy rights.
The original complaint included Jeffrey E. Epstein and Ivan S. Fisher as defendants regarding the unpermitted use of the premises.
